title: Amboli Ghat
subtitle: The Queen of Sahyadri – A misty paradise in the Western Ghats
overview: Amboli Ghat, located in the Sindhudurg district of Maharashtra, is one of the most scenic hill regions of the Western Ghats. It is known for its lush green forests, numerous waterfalls, and breathtaking viewpoints overlooking the Konkan coast.

Situated at an altitude of about 690 meters, Amboli receives one of the highest rainfalls in Maharashtra, making it a misty retreat and a favorite destination for nature lovers, trekkers, and photographers.

highlights.title: Monsoon Beauty
highlights.description: Amboli turns into a magical landscape of fog, waterfalls, and vibrant greenery during the monsoon.

highlights.title: Picturesque Viewpoints
highlights.description: Several viewpoints offer panoramic views of valleys and the Arabian Sea in the distance.

geography.intro: Amboli lies in the southern range of the Sahyadris, near the Goa-Maharashtra border, overlooking the lush Konkan plains.

details.label: River System
details.value: Part of the Hiranyakeshi River basin

details.label: Terrain
details.value: Dense tropical evergreen forests and steep ghats

climate.description: Amboli experiences a cool and pleasant climate throughout the year, with heavy rainfall from June to September. Winters are crisp and foggy, perfect for sightseeing.

seasons.text: Monsoon: June to September – best time to see waterfalls
Winter: October to February – ideal for nature walks and photography

geography.conclusion: Amboli is one of the last pristine ecosystems of the Western Ghats, offering unspoiled natural beauty and a refreshing climate.

activities.title: Trekking
activities.description: Explore short treks to waterfalls, viewpoints, and the surrounding forest trails.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture the charm of misty roads, waterfalls, and rich flora and fauna.
info: Morning fog adds magical lighting for photos

activities.title: Wildlife Watching
activities.description: Spot rare amphibians and endemic species of the Western Ghats.
info: Amboli Bush Frog and Flying Frog are highlights

attractions.title: Amboli Waterfall
attractions.description: A popular attraction cascading down rocky cliffs, surrounded by dense greenery.

attractions.title: Hiranyakeshi Temple
attractions.description: Ancient Shiva temple near the source of the Hiranyakeshi River.

attractions.title: Sea View Point
attractions.description: Offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Konkan coastline.

marineLife.intro: Though not coastal, Amboli is part of the biodiversity-rich Western Ghats, home to countless freshwater and forest species.

items.title: Endemic Amphibians
items.description: Species like the Amboli Bush Frog are unique to this region.

items.title: Forest Insects & Reptiles
items.description: Home to rare snakes, insects, and lizards thriving in the moist ecosystem.

conclusion: Amboli’s biodiversity is one of the richest in Maharashtra.
It plays a crucial role in the conservation of Western Ghats wildlife.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Amboli is 30 km from Sawantwadi via SH 121.
Well connected by road from Kolhapur, Belgaum, and Goa.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Regular trains from Mumbai, Pune, and Goa

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Taxis and buses available from airport

bookingTips.description: Several homestays and eco-resorts are available in Amboli town.
Best visiting time: June to February for pleasant weather.
Carry rain gear and proper footwear during the monsoon.
